Description: View through the Egyptian Room, in the Townley Gallery at the British Museum; obelisks to either side, the bust of Ramesses II at right before an arched doorway, the 'Discobolus' seen at the end of the gallery between two pillars, two turbanned figures looking on. 1820 Watercolour with scratching out
Curator's comments: Lit: S. Moser, 'Wondrous Curiosities. Ancient Egypt at the British Museum' (Chicago and London, 2006), Fig. 10 and p. 107; Ian Jenkins, 'Archeologists and Aesthetes in the Sculpture Galleries of the British Museum 1860-1939' (London, 1992), Plate VIII facing p. 144
